confession.seduction_context: angry because someone had stolen wood he had already cut; black man appeared and promised to tell him who had done this, adding that they did him much harm; resisted this time, but a few days later yielded against 'grandes promesses'
sabbat_activities: made hail by using brooms in spring

testimony.quarrel_subject: dispute over wall between their neighbouring houses
wife declined to attend betrothal ceremony
testimony.threat_quote: qu'elle l'avoit bien tost eu payé de la peine qu'il avoit prin a la marier et que ilz seroient bien tost a recommencer

testimony.quarrel_subject: dispute over who was responsible for field
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il luy feroit bien de l'autre mesnage

testimony.quarrel_subject: wife accused him of making her ill with pears and eggs

gave evidence for Claudon Demenge Jean Perry against accused

testimony.quarrel_subject: Demenge paid his own bill and left instead of letting witness pay for drinks

witnesses.name: Jean Parmentier de Neufviller

testimony.quarrel_subject: Demenge found his cow doing damage and told him off severely

timeline.subject: Demenge Milan
timeline.details: confronted with Laurence femme Colas Viney, who claimed to have seen him at sabat 15 years earlier, and again some 6 or 7 years before

timeline.subject: Demenge Milan
timeline.details: procureur asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Demenge Milan
timeline.details: Change de Nancy recommends instruments be shown and threatened with use

timeline.subject: Demenge Milan
timeline.details: full confession of seduction and malefices

timeline.subject: Demenge Milan
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves, subject to reiteration of confessions without torture

torture.restrictions: shown instruments and threatened with use if he does not confess

accomplices_named.name: Colatte femme Noel de Grand Ruix
woman of Ayemont
accomplices_named.context: saw at sabat; previously married to George du Paire, now remarried

accomplices_named.name: wife of Guillaume Bouchier
accomplices_named.context: thought he saw at sabat but could not affirm definitely

accomplices_named.name: wife of Holbin le Jalley
accomplices_named.context: thought he saw at sabat but could not affirm definitely

prior_accusations.context: claimed to have seen him at sabat 15 years earlier, and again some 6 or 7 years before

notable_quotes.speaker: Demenge Milan
notable_quotes.french: qu'il est homme de bien et supplie pour l'honneur de dieu que l'on ayt pitié de luy, de sa femme et enfans, et qu'on le mecte hors de prison. Que pour l'esgard de ce peu de bien qu'il a, il n'est pas sy ingrat qu'il n'en veuille recognoistre ses seigneurs pourveu qu'on luy saulve son honneur, de sa femme et de sesdits enfans, et que pour l'esgard du faict de genoxerie il en est aussy net, que l'enfant qu'est venu au monde du jourdhuy.
notable_quotes.english: that he is a good man and begs for the honor of God that they have pity on him, his wife and children, and that they let him out of prison. That regarding the little goods he has, he is not so ungrateful that he would not wish to acknowledge his lords provided they save his honor, his wife's and his children's, and that regarding the matter of witchcraft he is as clean as the child that came into the world today.

notable_quotes.speaker: Demenge Milan
notable_quotes.french: dict que non et qu'il se plaindoit une fois audit mre Navel du tort qu'ilz luy faisoient demandant s'il le sçauroit ayder, a quoy il respondit que non et qu'il ne se mesloit de la Justice et que les sorciers n'ont poinct de puissance sur les officiers ny sur tous ceulx qui ont bonne fiance en Dieu
notable_quotes.english: said no and that he complained once to said master Navel of the wrong they did him asking if he could help him, to which he responded no and that he did not meddle in Justice and that witches have no power over officers nor over all those who have good faith in God
notable_quotes.context: during confession, asked if he wanted to harm officials he had lawsuit with

notable_quotes.speaker: Demenge Milan to wife of Pierre Grosmaire
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle l'avoit bien tost eu payé de la peine qu'il avoit prin a la marier et que ilz seroient bien tost a recommencer
notable_quotes.english: that she had quickly been repaid for the trouble he had taken to marry her [daughter] and that they would soon be starting over again
notable_quotes.context: interpreted as threat before wife fell ill and died

notable_quotes.speaker: Demenge Milan to Jacquey Mandray
notable_quotes.french: qu'il luy feroit bien de l'autre mesnage
notable_quotes.english: that he would do him some other household harm
notable_quotes.context: after dispute over field, taken as threat and witnesses called

notable_quotes.speaker: wife of Jean Fleurat
notable_quotes.french: qu'il n'y avoit point de raison a elle
notable_quotes.english: that there was no reasoning with her
notable_quotes.context: Demenge's reply when she called him witch and accused him of making her ill

relationships.evidence_text: said only one he had was with his brother-in-law Claudon Demenge Jean Perry
First marriage, 28 years earlier, had been to Laurence fille Demenge Jean Perry of Remomeix, and had lasted 19 years
Second wife was Marguitte from St Jean d'Ormont, to whom he had been married for 9 years
Layte father and mother had been Demenge and Barbeline
Layte father and mother had been Demenge and Barbeline
dispute over wall between their neighbouring houses

relationships.person1: Claudatte fille feu Jean Demenge Perry
relationships.evidence_text: Claudatte fille feu Jean Demenge Perry
his late father Jean Simon (also maire)
Had left Demenge's service 18 months earlier, after 2 years

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: won lawsuit and constrained him to pay

harms_catalog.harm_description: suddenly taken ill, throwing herself across tables and benches, saying she had something in her body; died 9 weeks later
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: wife did not attend betrothal ceremony as expected
dispute over who was responsible for field; Sonrier decided against Demenge

harms_catalog.victim_name: Jacquey Mandray, son-in-law, and all children
harms_catalog.harm_description: unknown illness lasting more than 6 months, hardly visited by anyone else
harms_catalog.method_alleged: powder thrown over them as they sat outside house on a Sunday

harms_catalog.harm_description: mare would not go past Demenge's house; became ill on return home, died a week later
immediately became very ill, as if rabid, had to have her tied down; was still ill at time of trial
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Demenge gave her 5 pears and 2 eggs
harms_catalog.method_alleged: pears and eggs given by Demenge

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill immediately after auction, died 10 weeks later; maintained until death he had been bewitched
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: sold at auction the goods of Demenge's father on orders of Chapter (mortmain)
gave evidence for Claudon Demenge Jean Perry against accused

harms_catalog.harm_description: part of main wall fell down with huge stones; neighbors heard noise as if flock of sheep was on roof
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute over newly built house which Demenge wanted himself

harms_catalog.harm_description: whirlwind tore off most of roof, yet did not damage a single slate on Demenge's adjoining house
suddenly taken ill with stomach pains, as if punched in stomach; remained ill for 6 weeks, unable to use limbs; recovered completely within week of Demenge's visit
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Demenge paid his own bill and left instead of letting witness pay for drinks
Demenge found cow doing damage and told him off severely

harms_catalog.harm_description: killed with black powder to test it

harms_catalog.victim_name: cow of Claudon Demenge Jean Perry

material_culture.context: Demenge gave wife of Jean Fleurat 5 pears
Demenge sent wife of Jean Fleurat 2 eggs
Jean Mourel agreed to buy grain from Demenge; Jacquey Mandray was taking cartload of grain to town
given by devil; used to kill animals and harm people
used at sabbat to make hail in spring

spatial_references.context: primary location of trial; residence of accused and many witnesses
witness going to St Dié when met accused; Jean Fleurat's wife became ill on return from market at St Dié
location of stones where Claudon Demenge Jean Perry met accused
Pierre Grosmaire excused himself from betrothal because he had to go to St Marie
residence of Jennon veuve Colas Thiery and Jean Mourel
Jean Simon de la Vauvrelle was maire of St Marguerite
origin of Demenge's second wife Marguitte
location of Colatte femme Noel (accomplice named)
location of woman seen at sabbat

prior_legal_disputes.description: dispute over wall between neighbouring houses with Claudon Demenge Jean Perry
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: witness won lawsuit, had to constrain Demenge to pay

prior_legal_disputes.description: dispute over who was responsible for field ('vuider le bled du molin')
continually at law with brother-in-law Claudon Demenge Jean Perry for past 10 years
lawsuit with Noel Cayer and maire Hougney

legal_context.redress_outcome: came with officer to ask if Jacquey Mandray would make reparation; when Mandray refused, Demenge took no further action; came with doyen to complain to Jean Fleurat about wife's accusations; claimed Pierre Grosmaire made reparation for wife's accusations

change_de_nancy.modification_details: first recommended showing instruments and threatening with use; later approved death sentence subject to reiteration of confessions without any threat of torture

economic_context.details: multiple property disputes including wall between houses, field responsibility, house that Demenge wanted for himself; father's goods sold at auction on orders of Chapter due to mortmain; Demenge offered to give up his goods to save his honor and that of his family

hearsay_chains.content: heard late Colas Vincent accuse Demenge in public of making an ox lame after he had been seen near it, also claiming that a fine cow died as if rabid after he had deposed on behalf of Claudon Demenge Jean Perry against him
had heard Pierre Grosmaire's wife complain during fatal illness that Demenge had bewitched her

emotional_state_notes: after confrontations, pleaded for mercy for himself, wife and children
offered goods to save honor of family
professed innocence 'as clean as newborn child'
under torture, begged not to be tortured more
said he had tried a hundred times to escape from power of his master but could not

third_parties.name: Laurence femme Colas Viney
third_parties.context: confronted with accused on 1 August 1596; executed 13 August 1596; at execution discharged all she accused except mairesse Masson and Demenge

third_parties.name: late Colas Vincent
third_parties.context: deposed against Demenge in lawsuit with Valentin Thiehay and lost fine cow same day; publicly accused Demenge of making ox lame and cow die

third_parties.name: Noel Cayer
third_parties.context: had lawsuit with Demenge; Demenge asked devil if he could harm him but devil said no

third_parties.name: maire Hougney
third_parties.context: had lawsuit with Demenge; Demenge asked devil if he could harm him but devil said no

third_parties.name: George du Paire
third_parties.context: first husband of woman of Ayemont seen at sabbat

third_parties.name: Guillaume Bouchier
third_parties.context: wife possibly seen at sabbat but not confirmed

third_parties.name: Holbin le Jalley
third_parties.context: wife possibly seen at sabbat but not confirmed

third_parties.name: mairesse Masson
third_parties.context: Laurence femme Colas Viney did not discharge her at execution

extraction_metadata.notes: Well-documented trial with 15 witnesses, detailed timeline, and extensive confession under torture. Mother (Barbeline) previously suspected as witch. Trial initiated by confrontation with Laurence femme Colas Viney (executed 13 Aug 1596). Multiple property disputes and long-standing reputation (16 years). Change de Nancy consulted twice and approved both torture and death sentence.
